page.title: 03Landscapes and Buildings
page.content:
The land is put to either agricultural or commercial use.The higher land is generally to the North West and North East, away from the river and its swampy meadows and streamlets
To the South West crops are planted and are well cultivated. The buildings are well scattered apart from the industrial complex and the housing estate. Many old dwellings Chapels etc have been converted into dwelling places. Farm houses and cottages are mainly brick pre 1900 buildings and the hosing estate and factories are architect designed post war buildings. The sewage works has its own specialised buildings.
